comment: Meaning is very cool but it's awkward to say and I'm not a fan of 'palimp', too close to 'polyp'.
author: me

comment: On the cusp of overall good / not good. It's a bit too uncommon so it often feels out of place to just use. When paired with descriptions commonly used alongside it, such as 'cloud', its goodness improves.
author: me

comment: well I thought a specific feature was removed but apparently not so I can't make the comment I was going to make
author: me

comment: Despite sounding good (with similarities to words like 'sunder' and 'wander'), using good letters ('s', 'ond'), and having a meaning that I resonate with, the fact that this word was manufactured sours it. I need like 50 more years to accept it.
author: me
